Ⓐ + ほど + Ⓑ + は + Ⓒ + ない・いない・ありません・いません This means Ⓐ is not as Ⓒ as Ⓑ, where Ⓐ and Ⓑ are nouns and Ⓐ is an adjective or a verb.
・彼女ほど速く走れる人はいない。No one can run as fast as she can. この本ほど面白い本はない。There is no book as interesting as this book. 彼女は私ほど背が高くない。 She is not as tall as me. 彼女は彼ほど早く走れないのではないでしょうか。Doesn’t she run as fast as him? 彼女は彼ほど早く走れないのではないでしょうか。Doesn’t she run as fast as him?

Ⓐ + ように + Ⓑ Express similarity, manner or purpose. 1. This means Ⓑ is like or same way as Ⓐ. 2. In order to achieve Ⓐ, do Ⓑ.
・彼女は母親のように子供たちを世話する。 She takes care of the children like a mother. 彼は英語を話せるようになった。 He became able to speak English. 彼女は早く帰れるように頑張った。 She tried hard so that she could go home early. この部屋は暑すぎるように感じる。 This room feels too hot to me. 彼女は幸せになれるように祈った。 She prayed so that she could be happy.

Ⓐ condition + Ⓑ result Conditional-ba: いけば means if go or proceed. いいのに means it would be good. Express wish or regret. のに adds a sense of contradiction or dissatisfaction. 帰らずにmeans without going home. そんなに急いで means in such a hurry.
・もっと勉強すればいいのに。If only I studied more. 彼女が来ればいいのに。I wish she could come. 明日は雨が降らなければいいのに。I hope it doesn’t rain tomorrow. 彼らが幸せになればいいのに。I wish they could be happy. あなたが一緒に行けばいいのに。It would be nice if you could go with me.
